meanings.def: if two or more facts, figures, etc. correlate or if a fact, figure, etc. correlates with another, the facts are closely connected and affect or depend on each other
examples: The figures do not seem to correlate.
correlate with something A high-fat diet correlates with a greater risk of heart disease.
The average speed of the vehicles correlates closely with the severity of the accident caused.

meanings.def: to show that there is a close connection between two or more facts, figures, etc.
examples: Researchers are trying to correlate the two sets of figures.
Property values are negatively correlated to the tax rate.

meanings.def: one of two or more facts, figures, etc. that are closely connected and affect or depend on each other
examples: Drug use is a significant correlate of property crime.
